lexUnit.name: reduce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make smaller or less in amount, degree, or size

sentence.text: Book Marketing Ltd is preparing to reduce the cost of the licence fee for booksellers taking part in the summer National Book Sale in an attempt to encourage more active participation in the biannual event .
He eventually whittled it down to eighteen thousand and his successors have since reduced the number even more dramatically .
Both Coats Viyella ( 32% ) and Bass ( 33% ) reduced their audit fees by cutting the number of firms used .
Many investors also try to reduce risk by vertical integration .
Under this , farms would have to reduce output by 20 per cent .
` I 'll reduce it by fifty per cent .
Mr Collor promised to reduce inflation to just 3 per cent a month within a year by using shock tactics similar to those of President Menem of Argentina .
MMT Computing Plc reduced its stake in Total Systems Plc to under 3% .
I reduced the odds by wearing a pullover , slip-off shoes and no underwear , but it was still touch and go .
The UK quota reduced welfare by 14.33% while the EC minimum import price lowered welfare by approximately 2.01% .
By 1987 , the paid staff employed by the MCC had been reduced by half and the development emphasis had shifted to gentrification .
The number of German troops was to be reduced to 370,000 within three to four years .
The Soviet Union had agreed to reduce from 308 to 154 its arsenal of SS-18s , the heaviest ICBM in the world , each of which could carry 10 warheads .
We urge the Government to reduce from 60 to 10 years the life of minerals permissions through new legislation , as proposed in the consultation paper .
